name: electricity production, coal, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13215/documentation

This is a dataset used to create a global aluminium industry specific electricity market. The production volume represents the total amount of electricity from coal used globally for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;The share of electricity produced using lignite and hard coal is a weighted average of the share of each coal type in aluminium-producing countries (weighted by coal power consumption for aluminium production). The share in each country is for most countries identical to the split used in ecoinvent v3.2. For countries whose electricity production is not modelled in ecoinvent, coal-based electricity is assumed to be 78% hard coal, 22% lignite (based on 'rest of world' data, i.e. on data representing all regions not covered in ecoinvent v3.2). The share of each country in producing the global amount of coal electricity used in aluminium production was calculated regional data supplied by the International Aluminium Institute [IAI] and the European Aluminium Association [EAA], country-specific aluminium production volumes (source: EAA personal communication, IAI personnal communication) and general grid mix in the respective countries (sources: International Energy Agency or ecoinvent v3.2). ;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2015 data from IAI
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: All aluminium producing countries for which there is some coal power used for electrolysis.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal), shares of different types of coal power plants in the countries, when available, were used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, else 'Rest-of-world' split (33% lignite, 67% hard coal) was used, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: International Aluminium Institute (IAI) data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from coal power plants. ecoinvent data used to split coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal). The cited 93% representativeness is for IAI data (data based on 93% of global aluminium production). The percent representativeness of data used to split hydroelectricity production to different types of plants (national grid proxy) is 91%.

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology
